intro: Stera subspinescens, commonly known as the spiny sterar, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive spiny leaves and compact growth habit. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are often covered in fine, bristly hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are small and clustered, producing tiny fruits that are dispersed by wind.
